title: Heru
body:
Etymology of Name

Ussurian: Ïrü

The etymology of Heru is currently unknown, however it is used in similar form across The Known Lands and in the oldest historical records.

Orbit

Heru has an orbital period of 123.387612 Earth Years. Due to its slight axial tilt, the planet experiences long seasons of around 30 Earth Years.

Due to its long lunar cycle, inhabitants of Heru have adopted various calendars that use variations of "Moon Years" (such as the Ussurian Calendar), which divide the solar year into more managable year-like segmants by grouping a number of lunar cycles of the planet's moon, Edrae.

Climate

The planet's climate varies from season to season, and generally across the planet.

In the summer temperatures can reach highs of 60 degrees centigrade, whilst the winter can bring lows of -50 degrees centigrade.

Please see: Climate of the Known Lands

Habitation

Heru is inhabited by a variety of sentient humanoid species, as well as three sentient species of colonial single-celled microorganisms known to some as the Spirits:

  • Ћumans
  • Ëmans
  • Domaþund
  • Astana (extinct)
  • Dakïren (Ћumans-Astanan hybrid)
  • Turantör
  • Gägõs
  • Baskiþa
preface: Heru is the habitable planet that orbits the sun Caton.
